Description: Pottery oil lamp with seven nozzles; handle in form of a vulva with human/satyr's head at base. Remains of wick found in lamp. All nozzles badly burnt.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2010 Jan-April, Nottingham, The University of Nottingham, Lakeside Arts Centre, 'Roman Sexuality: Images, Myths and Meanings' 2014 Feb-May, Isle of Wight, Brading Roman Villa, 'Roman Sexuality: Images, Myths and Meanings'
Acquisition notes: Collected by Diana James in Egypt in the late 1950s.
